title.narrative: ED1-ACCESS TO INCLUSIVE QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, preschool and elementary school children and adolescents excluded from the education system have access to an inclusive quality education service

Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, preschool and elementary school children and adolescents excluded from the education system have access to an inclusive quality education service

description.narrative: This output focusses on access to quality education and aims at increasing the school capacity, classroom and school environment to ensure parity in education with the building of separated latrines and water point in schools. One pre-primary class to improve school preparedness for young children in targeted schools is set up and advocacy for community-based pre-schooling is also engaged while leveraging of resources with World Bank is ensured for the accelerated education program for out-of-school children is included in the Education Sectoral Plan (ESP) 2020-2029. . | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of children excluded from the preschool system supported by one of the forms of education (formal or non-formal) with the support of UNICEF
Percentage of primary-age children excluded from the system who are supported by one of the forms of education (formal or non-formal) with support from UNICEF
Service Delivery - Schools that have included life skills and citizenship education in their school plans with UNICEF support
Service Delivery - Number of primary classrooms built or rehabilitated with funding managed by UNICEF
Service Delivery - Early learning - Children in community based ECD centres
Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
Service Delivery - Classrooms provided with classroom education materials funded by UNICEF, see guidance
Service Delivery - Emergency response - School aged children targeted by UNICEF that have access to psychosocial support in their schools/learning spaces during and after the humanitarian situation
Country shows improvements in learning outcomes (Y/N)
Existence of a school inclusion strategy for excluded girls and boys based on the analysis of their profiles and bottlenecks hindering their schooling

actual.value: 2019:Preparation of out of scool children study is ongoing.
